titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the English Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by John Espy

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 07:28

did.unittitle: English Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: An artificial collection of correspondence, financial, legal, and government documents, political memoirs, military records, literary manuscripts, and autographs relating to Great Britain, 1362-1945. An anonymous essay about Charlotte Corday, memoirs attributed to George Grenville, and writings by George Grote and Sir Henry Maine are included.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: English Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection (MS 753). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers in this collection have cross-reference slips in the manuscript catalog and fuller descriptions in the inventory catalog. However, these slips do not indicate where in the collection items may be found. It may be necessary for the reader to look in several containers in order to find an item. Unless the item is one of the few which this listing mentions individually, or is likely to be one of the autographs in box 15 or one of the large legal documents in folio 21 A+B, it is probably best to begin by checking under the proper date in boxes 1-9. Small legal documents will also be found here. If the item is not found, the reader should check folios 18 and 21 A+B (or box 12 if the date is 1848 or 1850). Items in these folios, as in boxes 1-9, are in chronological order and may be quickly found. It is possible, however, that an item, to which a date is assigned in the catalog, has been misfiled in the "undated" section at the end of boxes 9 and 10, folio 48, and folio 21 A+B.

This collection is no longer expanding. New acquisitions are being added instead to the English Miscellaneous Manuscripts - Numbered Series, and individually cataloged in the manuscript and union catalogs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

General Papers

A-L

Edward IV (1442-1483): document with seal (missing, 1980 Sep)
John Collett: letters to an uncle and a sister (photostats)
Charles Lennox Richmond, 2nd Duke of Richmond (1701-1750): letters from the Duke of Newcastle, Henry Pelham, Andrew Stone, and Sir T. Prendergast (photostats)
Various
Valentine Browne Kenmare, Earl of Kenmare (1788-1853): catalog of library
Great Britain, Patent Office: Letters patent granted to John Holt, Jr.
Autographs and Biographies of Eminent Englishmen
20 biographies of famous men and women: manuscript, in volume, with engravings
Autographs of British statesmen
Engravings and autographs of royalty
Album of autographs, collected by Jemima E. (Branfill) Harrison, John Branfill Harrison, and Edith Dering Harrison
Jones, Daniel, d.1847
Ms, "Business letter book..." with 5 pay orders laid in
Ms, "Business letter book..."
Jones, Elihu
Ms account book of the estate of John Vyse, perhaps of Eton, kept by Elihu Jones as executor. 1v.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: John Jones figures prominently in the transactions.
The pages are loose and erratically numbered.

did.unittitle: Jones, John, Sr., b.1825
Notecard, invitation to him "...to Dine with your newly elected Members...Wendover..."

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Wendover had an election to Parliament in this year, and this may be an allusion to new members of Parliament.
Removed from one of the account books of the Jones family of Wendover, Bucks.

did.unittitle: Jones, John
Ms. memorandum book listing commodities to be purchased possibly for John Jones, but not in his hand, together with entries about rentals
Jones, The Reverend Mr.

Ms., church notebooks kept by the Rev. Mr. Jones as pastor of the Church of Christ (Congregational) in Epping, Essex, giving outline of 4 sermons and the texts of many. At the back of the volume are nine pages of inventory of personal and household legacy receipts, accounts, etc. of [John] Vyse's will, which may indicate that the inventory was for Elihu Jones's house. He was one of John Vyse's executors.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: See also: box 16, folder 4

did.unittitle: Also in the same volume, 4 pages of ledger entries for rents collected in London. In the hand of Daniel Jones?

odd.head: General note
odd.p: In the letter books of William Jones, Jr., it appears that Daniel Jones settled the estate of his brother Elihu.

did.unittitle: Ms. household and rental accounts

odd.head: General note
odd.p: No covers. On verso of the last sheet are drawings of two birds in color.

did.unittitle: Jones, William, Jr.
2 ms. copy books of letters written from Wendover and London, England to his family (mainly his father) in Brooklyn, New York

odd.head: General note
odd.p: William Jones, Jr. was in England to settle the estate of his uncle, Daniel Jones of Wendover. He spent most of his time in London, but also visited Paris.

did.unittitle: Pearson, Adam & Co.
Bill of exchange in favor of S.M. Swift of Surinam, Dutch Guiana, drawn on Adam Pearson & Co., London
Endorsed on verso by Swift in favor of James Stevenson of Boston. Paramaribo, Dutch Guiana.
Christie, Gabriel, 1722-1799
ALS to Thomas Bullock on money matters and to ask him to thank General Prevost for his help to his nephew. [4] p.

ALS to Colonel Glen at Schenectady on laying in fifteen hundred loads of wood, informing Glen that the Earl of Loudoun will pay for putting up a fence and gate, but not for splitting firewood. 1 p., address on verso
Becker, Thomas
ALS conveying an obituary to an unidentified correspondent for publication "this month." London, 1 p.
Seven Years' War, 1756-1763

AD (contemporary copies of originals), 1761 and 1763, concerning British supply arrangements and accounts in Germany with a listing of the British bakery and infirmary wagons, horses and servants in Hameln, 1761 Oct 20, the Hessian bread wagon train in Hameln, 1761 Nov 5, and the train for the service of Duke Ferdinand, Hameln, 1761 Nov 5. In addition there are copies of King George III's appointment of a commission consisting of Thomas Pownall, Charles Wolfran Cornwall and David Cuthbert for "Inquiring and Stating the Debts for Extraordinaries in Germany," together with "Instructions" [incomplete], 1763 Sep 21. Also a copy of a letter from Thomas Whately to the Commissioners for Examining German Demands, 1763 Oct 17 transmitting a minute of His Majesty's Treasury, 1763 Jul 15 with further instructions for the commissioners. [14] p.
Greg, Walter Wilson, 1875-1959
ALS to Mr. Troscall with corrections for the Griggs facsimile, 1880, of Midsummer Night's Dream , London, [2] p.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Removed from Midsummer Night's Dream, Shakespeare Quarto facsimile, London, 1880.

did.unittitle: Fort Montague Bank
DS (printed form filled in), promissory note numbered 28962 and signed by T. Hill for the governor of Fort Montague & Co. Made out to John Flag.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Sheet. 11 x 17 cm. Inlaid and repaired.

did.unittitle: Guy, Henry, 1631-1710
ADS, pay orders to Sir Robert Howard, auditor of the Exchequer, to issue payments at the desire of "the Lord Commissioner] of his Ma[jesty's] Treasury." All signed by Guy and endorsed on the verso.
For payment to Phillip Burton out of "Popish" funds
For payment to Bevill Skelton out of funds lent by Charles Toll
For payment to the paymaster of the Forces and "myself for his Ma[jesty's] Secret Service" out of "Excize money"
For payment to Lord Lucas, Phillip Burton, Ursula Elliot and "myself for his Ma[jesty's] Secret Service." Funds advanced to Mr. Guy by Sir George Downing.
For payment to Charles Fox, paymaster of the Forces, and to Bevill Skelton in Holland for the Scotch and English regiment
For payment to Phillip Burton for prosecution of law suits
For payment to Lord Ranelagh for the Forces
Great Britain Exchequer
5 ADS, pay orders to the Exchequer.
Order to Sir Robert Howard for annuities to Honora Harding and Dorothy Byron. Signatures by Albermarle and three others [illegible].
Order to Sir Robert Howard for Thomas Baker, Agent and Consul General for Tripoli in Barbary. Signed Danby.
Order in favor of Nicholas Johnson, paymaster of the Forces, with endorsement by Nicholas Johnson.
Order to Sir Thomas Vernon for Bevil Skelton, Ambassador Extraordinary to the Emperor of Germany, with endorsements by Hyde, Dering, Fox and one other [illegible]
Order in favor of Emmanuel Scroop How, groom of the bed-chamber. Receipted by E.S. Howe.
5 ADS, receipts for payments for services.
Receipt for six pounds, 13 shillings, four pence to William Tey, yeoman of the Guards.
Receipt for six pounds, 13 shillings, four pence to John Talbott, yeoman of the Guards.
Receipt

Receipt for one tally from the Tally Court "contayninge ye sume of two hundred and fifty pounds levied upon the tenthes of ye clergie within ye diocese of Exeter..." Signed [in another hand]: A. Bristoll.

Receipt for one thousand pounds from the Exchequer out of additional tonnage, signed by Thomas Dummer for John, duke of Montagu, Master of the Great Wardrobe, upon account of the twenty thousand pounds awarded him "for his services in that office..."
[Anonymous]
2 AMS, sermons on Job 2:10 and Galations 5:22:23 preached in various English towns. v.p. [each 12 p.]
Fiji. H.B.M. Consul
Fiji and Tonga despatches to the Foreign Office. [Suva, Central Archives of Fiji and the Western Pacific High Commission, 1968], 96 leaves

did.unittitle: Philanthropos, pseud.
Ms poem in mock heroic couplets, "Answer to some elegaic reflections composed by the Hon. Princess Eugenia on the proceedings of the 26th of October 1757." n.p., [2] p. on one leaf
Commonplace book

odd.head: General note
odd.p: [Pious meditations on the deaths of Elizabeth Smith (1777-1806), Henry Kirke White (1785-1806) and George Whitefield (1714-1770). Also included are extracts from diaries, poems, sermons, essays on morals and religion.] n.p., 20 p., torn and stained

did.unittitle: ALS to "Dear Osgood" on the death of the writer's son and expected death of his infant daughter. [Southampton, England?] 2 p. on one leaf

Autograph album of poems, religious sentiments and two drawings in chalk and gold ink. Included is a motto signed by Thomas Shakespear, described on the page as "the only known descendant of the great Poet."

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Mutilated. Several leaves cut out. One leaf with a poem "From Test-us''" by Philip James Bailey, transferred to Beinecke Rare Book. Library. v.p., 1v.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Ms invoices for goods shipped from London to Messrs. Mercer & Ramsay in New York. The cargoes consist of pottery, silver, cloth, wool, buttons, stays and other domestic articles. Bound in is a letter asking for payment and cautioning the buyers not to overstock.
1759 May 2, May 26, Jun 8, London
13 leaves, bound together
